Summary: far distance, moved quite swiftly, stopped at a star, disapeared.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Otterburn Park
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsok here's what happened. i'm not entirely sure this was a ufo sighting, but it seemed odd to me, and i have had a weird feeling about it since i saw it. better to report it and find out it was probably nothing, then not to report it and find out it really was something right? so here it is. i'm walking home from a long walk, it was around 11, and i noticed a brite, starlike thing in the sky. i don't really know why but i just glanced up into the sky at that moment, and it caught my eye because it was moving. i thought for a moment it could be a plane, but dismissed the thought quickly as it looked exactly like one of the brightest stars. but it was moving, so i thought maybe it was a satellite...but then dismissed that thought because it was moving too fast to be a satellite. then, for some unknown reason, it stopped next to a star that kinda went from blue to green to red to white over and over (flashing) if you looked closely at it. it was smaller in size next to the star-like shape, and then all of a sudden, the starlike shape was gone. it had been there, and then not. during this entire encounter i felt confused and a little scared though i can't say why. when it disapeared i thought for a moment maybe i just lost it and if i looked around it would be there, but it was no where. the whole thing kinda freaked me out, i started walking really quickly back to my house. it was very odd, and i don't know if it was a ufo but i thought it might be good to report. all this happened about 3\4 the way of the road hillside, between the school and my house, in otterburn park at around 11 o'clock at night.
